00049        %> maximal length of pidx index
00050        max_len_pidx;
00051        %> index to first col of pidx where boundary is set
00052        iidx;

00068        Sn_map;

00077          % ================================================================
00078          %> @brief Constructor. Overload.       
00079          %>         
00080          %> @param First:varargin{1} sensor object
00081          %> @param First:varargin{2} permittivity_distribution object
00082          %> @param First:varargin{3} side size of square simulation matrix         
00083          %> @param Second:varargin{1} sensor object
00084          %> @param Second:varargin{2} permittivity_distribution object
00085          %> @param Second:varargin{3} side size of square simulation matrix
00086          %> @param Second:varargin{4} capacitance error amplitude e.g. error_V = 0.001 - 1 mV or 'none'
00087          %> @param Second:varargin{5} capacitance error range e.g. range_V = 10 - 10 V or 'none'                        
00088          %> @param Second:varargin{6} method use to compute potential maps 'gauss' or 'kirchoff' (set if you know how to use it)                                 
00089          %>
00090          %> @return instance of the Electrical_field_2D class.
00091          % ================================================================
00092          function ef_obj = Electrical_field_2D(varargin)           
00093           if nargin == 0 ; % no input arguments
00094           elseif isa(varargin{1},'Electrical_field_2D')
00095             ef_obj = varargin{1}; % copy constructor
00096             display 'copy constructor Electrical_field_2D'
00097             return;          
00098           else
00099              switch(nargin)
00100                 case 3, 
00101                     display 'creating electrical field'
00102                     if((isa(varargin{1},'Sensor_2D')==1)&&(isa(varargin{2},'Permittivity_distribution_2D')==1))
00103                         display 'creating Sensor_2D'
00104                         ef_obj.sensor=varargin{1};
00105                         ef_obj.permittivity_distribution=varargin{2};
00106                         ef_obj.simulation_discret_matrix_size=varargin{3};
00107                         ef_obj.pot_method='gauss';
00108                         ef_obj.error_V='none';
00109                         ef_obj.range_V='none';
00110                     end
00111                 case 6, 
00112                     display 'creating electrical field'
00113                     if((isa(varargin{1},'Sensor_2D')==1)&&(isa(varargin{2},'Permittivity_distribution_2D')==1))
00114                         display 'creating Sensor_2D'
00115                         ef_obj.sensor=varargin{1};
00116                         ef_obj.permittivity_distribution=varargin{2};
00117                         ef_obj.simulation_discret_matrix_size=varargin{3};
00118                         ef_obj.error_V=varargin{4};
00119                         ef_obj.range_V=varargin{5};
00120                         ef_obj.pot_method=varargin{6}; % 'gauss or kirchoff'
00121                     end
00122                     
00123              otherwise
00124                     display 'no input elements';                   
00125              end   
00126                     
00127                         ms=ef_obj.sensor.discretization_grid.matrix_size_mm;
00128                         gs=ef_obj.sensor.discretization_grid.grid_size_mm;
00129                         ef_obj.discretization_grid=Discretization_grid_2D_square(ms,gs);
00130                         
00131                         ef_obj.discretization_grid=ef_obj.sensor.discretization_grid+ef_obj.permittivity_distribution.Discretization_grid_perm;
00132                         
00133                         ef_obj.iidx=1:ef_obj.discretization_grid.discret_matrix_size*ef_obj.discretization_grid.discret_matrix_size;
00134                         ef_obj.iidx=ef_obj.iidx.*0;                                        
00135                                                                                                
00136                         len_sens_elements=length(ef_obj.sensor.vector_sensor_elements);
00137                         
00138                         for n=1:len_sens_elements
00139                             ef_obj.max_len_pidx=ef_obj.max_len_pidx + length(ef_obj.sensor.vector_sensor_elements(n).point_list); 
00140                         end
00141                         
00142                         tmp=1:ef_obj.max_len_pidx;
00143                         tmp=tmp'.*0;
00144                         ef_obj.pidx(:,1)=tmp;
00145                         ef_obj.pidx(:,2)=tmp;
00146                         ef_obj.pidx(:,3)=tmp;
00147                         ef_obj.pidx(:,4)=tmp;
00148                         
00149                         
00150                         % create pidx only for elements inside screen and
00151                         % for screen
00152                         size(1,1)=ef_obj.sensor.discretization_grid.discret_matrix_size;
00153                         size(1,2)=ef_obj.sensor.discretization_grid.discret_matrix_size;
00154                                                 
00155                         ef_obj.number_of_electrodes=0;
00156                         
00157                         for i=1:len_sens_elements
00158                                                                                    
00159                             vol=ef_obj.sensor.vector_sensor_elements(i).voltage;     
00160                             
00161                             if(strcmp(vol,'none'))
00162                                 pot_flag = 0;   % not boundary condition
00163                             else
00164                                 pot_flag = 1;   % boundary condition
00165                             end
00166 
00167                             el_name=ef_obj.sensor.vector_sensor_elements(i).element_name;
00168                             
00169                             if(strcmp(el_name,'electrode'))
00170                                 ef_obj.number_of_electrodes=ef_obj.number_of_electrodes+1;
00171                                 ef_obj.B_map(:,:,ef_obj.number_of_electrodes)=ef_obj.sensor.vector_sensor_elements(i).discretization_grid_of_voltage.get_matrix();                                                                
00172                             end
00173                                                                  
00174                                 pl=ef_obj.sensor.vector_sensor_elements(i).point_list;
00175                                 ind=length(ef_obj.pidx);
00176                                 for k=1:length(pl)
00177                                     % linear index
00178                                     ef_obj.pidx(ind+k,1)=pl(k);
00179 
00180                                     [x,y]=ind2sub(size,pl(k));
00181 
00182                                     ef_obj.pidx(ind+k,2)=x;
00183                                     ef_obj.pidx(ind+k,3)=y;
00184                                     ef_obj.pidx(ind+k,4)=pot_flag;
00185                                 end
00186                           
00187                         end  % end for all elements in the sensor
00188                         
00189                         % pidx must be in ascending order
00190                         ef_obj.pidx=sortrows(ef_obj.pidx,1);
00191                                                      
00192                             for m=1:length(ef_obj.pidx)
00193                                 ef_obj.iidx(ef_obj.pidx(m))=m;
00194                             end                            
00195                                                                        
00196                         % number of measurements (electrode pairs) all=1 with, all=0 without repeats
00197                             
00198                             ef_obj.measurements_all = 0;
00199                         if ef_obj.measurements_all==1 % electrode combinations
00200                             ef_obj.measurement_count = ef_obj.number_of_electrodes*(ef_obj.number_of_electrodes-1);  % number of measurement 
00201                         else
00202                             ef_obj.measurement_count = ef_obj.number_of_electrodes*(ef_obj.number_of_electrodes-1)/2;  % number of measurement 
00203                         end
00204 
00205                         % should be equal to sensor.measurement_count
00206                         ef_obj.sens_matrix_num = ef_obj.measurement_count;  % number of sub sensitivity matrixs
00207                             
00208                             
00209                        ef_obj.discret_matrix_size=ef_obj.permittivity_distribution.Discretization_grid_perm.discret_matrix_size;
00210                        
00211                        % adding phantom do sensor discretization grid,
00212                        % phantom should be merged with FOV (FOV values included)
00213                        point_list=ef_obj.permittivity_distribution.fov_indicies_vector;
00214                        ef_obj.discretization_grid_sensor_and_phantom=ef_obj.sensor.discretization_grid;                                                                     
00215                        ef_obj.discretization_grid_sensor_and_phantom.value_list(point_list)=ef_obj.permittivity_distribution.Discretization_grid_perm.value_list(point_list);
00216                       
00217                        ef_obj.eps_map=ef_obj.discretization_grid_sensor_and_phantom.get_matrix();
00218                        
00219                        ef_obj.potential_distribution_maps=ef_obj.potential_distrib(ef_obj.pot_method);
00220                        ef_obj.S_map=ef_obj.sens_matrix(ef_obj.potential_distribution_maps,1);
00221                                                                                             
00222                        %reshape;
00223                         ef_obj.S = reshape(ef_obj.S_map, ef_obj.discret_matrix_size*ef_obj.discret_matrix_size,  ef_obj.sens_matrix_num)';% ?
00224                                          
00225                         ef_obj.Sn = ef_obj.sens_norm_lbp(ef_obj.S);  
00226                        
00227                         
00228                         ef_obj.Sn_map = reshape(ef_obj.Sn', ef_obj.discret_matrix_size, ef_obj.discret_matrix_size, ef_obj.sens_matrix_num);% ?
00229                         
00230                    
00231                     simulation_matrix=ef_obj.permittivity_distribution.Discretization_grid_perm.get_matrix();
00232         
00233                     ef_obj.C = ef_obj.projections(ef_obj.error_V,ef_obj.range_V);
00234 
00235                     sim_discret_matrix_size=ef_obj.simulation_discret_matrix_size;
00236                     ef_obj.Eps_fovImgToReconstruction_map = ef_obj.getFOV(ef_obj.sensor,sim_discret_matrix_size, simulation_matrix, 1,'bilinear');                    
00237              
00238                     
00239                     ef_obj.Eps_fovImgToReconstruction=reshape(ef_obj.Eps_fovImgToReconstruction_map,numel(ef_obj.Eps_fovImgToReconstruction_map),1);
00240                     
00241                     ef_obj.S_resize = ef_obj.get_resize_sensitivity(sim_discret_matrix_size,'bilinear');
00242                     
00243                     ef_obj.Sn_resize = ef_obj.sens_norm_lbp(ef_obj.S_resize);  
00244                            
00245           end
00246          
00247          end

00249          % ================================================================
00250          %> @brief Draw values of all capacitances. Use current figure.
00251          % ================================================================
00252          function draw_capacitances(ef_obj)
00253           
00254             plot(ef_obj.C);                                       
00255             title('Capacitances between electrode pairs');
00256             xlabel('Pair of electrodes');
00257             ylabel('Capacitance [arbitrary units]');

00260          % ================================================================        
00261          %> @brief Draw permittivity distribution for sensor and phantom. Two modes  
00262          %> available: auto or thresholds.
00263          %>
00264          %> @param varargin{1} mode - auto or threshold
00265          %> @param varargin{2} value of lower threshold (if threshold mode enable else witout this field)
00266          %> @param varargin{3} value of upper threshold (if threshold mode enable else witout this field)       
00267          % ================================================================        
00268          function draw_eps_map(varargin)  
00269            
00270            % default - auto
00271            if nargin==1
00272                ef_obj=varargin{1};
00273                ef_obj.discretization_grid_sensor_and_phantom.set_display_thresholds('auto');
00274                ef_obj.discretization_grid_sensor_and_phantom
00275                                               
00276            % thresholds
00277            elseif nargin==4
00278                 ef_obj=varargin{1};
00279                 mode=varargin{2};
00280                 lt_tmp=varargin{3};
00281                 ut_tmp=varargin{4};
00282                 
00283                 if (strcmp(mode,'thresholds'))                    
00284                     ef_obj.discretization_grid_sensor_and_phantom.set_display_thresholds('thresholds',lt_tmp,ut_tmp);
00285                     ef_obj.discretization_grid_sensor_and_phantom
00286                 else
00287                     error 'Incorrect threshold mode'
00288                 end                                
00289                 
00290            else
00291                error 'Incorrect number of input elements'
00292            end                  
00293              
00294          end
00295           
00296          % ================================================================         
00297          %> @brief Draw potential map for one or all electrodes.
00298          %>
00299          %> @param el electrode number - draw set potential map or 'all' - draw all potential maps
00300          % ================================================================         
00301          function [] = draw_potential(ef_obj,el) 
00302                 
00303              if (strcmp(el,'all'))
00304                 ef_obj.draw_potential_(ef_obj.potential_distribution_maps(:,:,el), el);
00305              else
00306                 ef_obj.draw_potential_(ef_obj.potential_distribution_maps(:,:,el));
00307              end
00308            
00309          end
00310          
00311          % ================================================================         
00312          %> @brief Draw one sensitivity map or all maps. 
00313          %>
00314          %> @param val sensitivity map number - draw set sensitivity map or 'all' - draw all sensitivity maps
00315          % ================================================================         
00316          function [] = draw_sensitivity(ef_obj,val)
00317              
00318              if(strcmp(val,'all'))
00319                            
00320                 for sm=1:1:ef_obj.sens_matrix_num
00321                     figure;
00322                     ef_obj.draw_sensitivity_(ef_obj.S_map(:,:,sm)); % draw only for first electrode                 
00323                 end
00324                                  
00325              else      
00326                  ef_obj.draw_sensitivity_(ef_obj.S_map(:,:,val));       
00327              end   
00328 
00329          end
00330          
00331          % =================================================================        
00332          %> @brief Function gets full size sensitivity single matrix then resize
00333          %> each map. Return resize sensitivity single matrix and set this
00334          %> matrix into object.
00335          %>
00336          %> @param image_matrix_size size of matrix side (resize matrix size)
00337          %> @param method see imresize (image processsing toolbox)
00338          %> @retval S_resize vector of resized sensitivity maps
00339          % ================================================================         
00340          function S_resize = get_resize_sensitivity(ef_obj,image_matrix_size,method)  
00341              S=ef_obj.S;
00342              [r,c]=size(S);
00343              x=ef_obj.discretization_grid.number_of_x_axis_pixel;
00344              y=ef_obj.discretization_grid.number_of_y_axis_pixel;
00345              for i=1:1:r
00346                  S_vector=S(i,:);                 
00347                  S_single = reshape(S_vector,y,x);
00348                  fovSensR = ef_obj.getFOV(ef_obj.sensor,image_matrix_size, S_single, 1,method);
00349                  S_single = reshape(fovSensR,1,numel(fovSensR));
00350                  S_resize(i,:)=S_single(:);
00351                  res=reshape(S_single,image_matrix_size,image_matrix_size);
00352                  S_map_resize(:,:,i)=res(:,:);
00353              end
00354              ef_obj.S_resize=S_resize;
00355              ef_obj.S_map_resize=S_map_resize;
00356              return
00357          end
00358         
00359          % ================================================================
00360          %> @brief Draw sum of sensitivity maps.         
00361          % ================================================================
00362          function [] = draw_sum_S_map(ef_obj)
00363             map=sum(ef_obj.S_map,3);
00364             mesh(map);
00365             set(gca,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00366             title('Full Size Sensitivity Maps Sum');
00367             zlabel('Sensitivity [arbitrary units]');
00368             xlabel('grid:x');
00369             ylabel('grid:y');
00370          end
00371          
00372          % ================================================================
00373          %> @brief Draw inverse sum of sensitivity maps.         
00374          % ================================================================
00375          function [] = draw_inv_S_map(ef_obj,u);
00376             S=ef_obj.S;
00377                     
00378             mtx_size=ef_obj.discret_matrix_size;     
00379             sens_mtx_number=ef_obj.sens_matrix_num;
00380             iS = S'/(S*S' + u*diag(diag(S*S')));
00381             res=reshape(iS,[mtx_size mtx_size sens_mtx_number]);
00382             wyn=sum(res,3);
00383             mesh(wyn)
00384             set(gca,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00385             title('Inverse Full Size Sensitivity Maps Sum');
00386             zlabel('Sensitivity [arbitrary units]');
00387             xlabel('grid:x');
00388             ylabel('grid:y');
00389          end
00390

00392          %> @brief Draw sum of resize sensitivity maps.
00393          % ================================================================
00394          function [] = draw_sum_resize_S_map(ef_obj)

00405          %> @brief Draw sum of potential maps.
00406          % ================================================================
00407          function [] = draw_sum_pot_map(ef_obj)

00410             set(gca,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);                                                  
00411             title('Potential Maps Sum');

00415          end

00417          % =====================================================================
00418          %> @brief Draw resize sensitivity map.
00419          %>
00420          %> @param val sensitivity map number or 'all' - draw all maps
00421          %> @param image_sizex x dimension size of rescale map (x dimension of output drawing)
00422          %> @param image_sizey y dimension size of rescale map (y dimension of output drawing) 
00423          %> @param new_figure 1-create new figure 0-don't creat new figure         
00424          % =====================================================================
00425          function [] = draw_resize_sensitivity(ef_obj,val,image_sizex,image_sizey,new_figure)
00426             [r,c]=size(ef_obj.S_resize);
00427             if(strcmp(val,'all'))                
00428                 for i=1:1:r                    
00429                     tmp=ef_obj.S_resize(i,:);
00430                     img=reshape(tmp,image_sizey,image_sizex);
00431                     if(new_figure==1)
00432                         figure;
00433                     end
00434                     image(img,'cdatamapping','scaled');
00435                     drawnow;                    
00436                     set(gca,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00437                 end
00438             else
00439                 if(val<=r && val > 0 )
00440                     tmp=ef_obj.S_resize(val,:);
00441                     img=reshape(tmp,image_sizey,image_sizex);
00442                     if(new_figure==1)
00443                         figure;
00444                     end
00445                     image(img,'cdatamapping','scaled');
00446                     set(gca,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00447                 else
00448                     display 'out of index';
00449                 end                
00450             end            
00451             % end 'main' if
00452          end
00453          % end function draw_resize_sensitivity

00455         % =========================================================================
00456         %> @brief returns FOV part of given image
00457         %>
00458         %> @param sensor sensor object
00459         %> @param image_matrix_size side size of input image
00460         %> @param simulation_phantom_matrix side size of rescale image
00461         %> @param rescale flag if rescale to reconsruction matrix size have to be done
00462         %> 0 no, 1 yes (default value is 1)
00463         %> @param method  interpolating method for image rescaling (default is bilinear).
00464         %> For more see imresize help.
00465         %>
00466         %> @retval fovImg rescale permittivity distribution of FOV
00467         % =========================================================================
00468         function [fovImg] = getFOV(ef_obj,sensor,image_matrix_size, simulation_phantom_matrix, rescale, method)
00469          [fovImg] = getFOV(ef_obj,sensor,image_matrix_size, perm_distrib, rescale, method);
00470         
00471         % =========================================================================
00472         %> @brief putFOV returns image where given fov was put into given image
00473         %>
00474         %> @param sensor        sensor object
00475         %> @param perm_distrib  permittivity distribution object
00476         %> @param fovImgR       side size of reconstruction image
00477         %> @param method        interpolating method for image rescaling (default is bilinear).
00478         %>                      For more see imresize help.
00479         %> @param fillBorder    flag, 0-1, extrapolate borders of fov to fill whole fov
00480         %>                      in simulation resolution (0 no fill, 1 fill, default 0)
00481         %> @retval img          resize image
00482         % =========================================================================
00483         function [img] = putFOV(ef_obj,sensor, perm_distrib, fovImgR, method,fillBorder)
00484          [fovImg] = putFOV(ef_obj,sensor, perm_distrib, fovImgR, method,fillBorder);
00485     end
00486    
00487    methods(Access=private)
00488          
00489         % =====================================================================
00490         %> @brief potential_distrib calculates potential distrubution 
00491         %>
00492         %> @param method - method of calculation of coefficients
00493         %>         'gauss' - (default) using gauss law (integral eqation)
00494         %>         'kirchhof' - calculating potential using capacitor mesh and
00495         %>          Kirchhof law
00496         %>         'finite difference' - not implemented
00497         %>
00498         %> @retval V potential distribution vector of maps
00499         % =====================================================================
00500         function [V]=potential_distrib(ef_obj,method)
00501         V = potential_distrib(ef_obj,method);                  
00502         % include:
00503         
00504         % =====================================================================
00505         %> @brief pot_matrix creates matrix for potential equation using list of
00506         %> points
00507         %>
00508         %> @param discret_matrix_size    side size of matrix
00509         %> @param potential_points_idx   index use to potential computing
00510         %> @param potential_points_iidx  index to first col of pidx where boundary is set
00511         %> @param P                      map of permittivity distribution
00512         %> @param method - method of calculation of coefficients
00513         %>         'gauss' - (default) using gauss law (integral eqation)
00514         %>         'kirchhof' - calculating potential using capacitor mesh and
00515         %>          Kirchhof law
00516         %>         'finite difference' - not implemented
00517         %>
00518         %> @retval A(pixnum,pixnum) where pixnum is the number of unknown potential points
00519         % =====================================================================
00520         function A=pot_matrix(ef_obj,discret_matrix_size,potential_points_idx,potential_points_iidx,P,method)
00521         A = pot_matrix(ef_obj,discret_matrix_size,pidxx,iidx,eps_map,draw,method);
00522         
00523         % =====================================================================
00524         %> @brief solveLU performs backward step of Gauss elimination calculates potential distrubutions 
00525         %> using matrix A and many vectors of free elements (boundary conditions)
00526         %>
00527         %> @param m witdh of matrix band
00528         %> @param A  matrix of linear system for potential distribution
00529         %> @param B  vectors with boundary conditions
00530         %>
00531         %> @retval V potential matrix to solve
00532         % =====================================================================
00533         function [V] = solveLU(ef_obj,m,A,B)
00534         [V] = solveLU(ef_obj,m,A,B);
00535         
00536         % =====================================================================
00537         %> @brief thomas2 creates upper triangular matrix using band diagonal
00538         %> structure of matrix
00539         %>
00540         %> @param rows       rows number of potential matrix 
00541         %> @param cols       cols number of potential matrix 
00542         %> @param A          potential matrix
00543         %> @param elnum      number of electrodes, number of columns in B matrix of free elements 
00544         %> @param B          boundary conditions - maps of applied voltage
00545         %>
00546         %> @retval A - upper triangular matrix
00547         %> @retval B - vector of free elements
00548         % =====================================================================
00549         function [A,B] = thomas2(ef_obj,rows,cols,A,elnum,B)
00550         [A,B] = thomas2(ef_obj,rows,cols,A,elnum,B,draw);
00551

00556         %> @param varargin{2} electrode num (optional)

00559         [] = draw_potential_(ef_obj,V, num)

00563         %>

00565         %> @param draw  draw calculated map if ~= 0

00567         % =====================================================================
00568         function [S]=sens_matrix(ef_obj,V,draw)
00569         [S]=sens_matrix(ef_obj,V, draw)

00571         % =====================================================================
00572         %> @brief Calculates sensitivity map using reciprocity theorem and mutual impedance
00573         %>
00574         %> @param V1 potential map when first electrode is an application electrode
00575         %> @param V2 potential map when 2-nd  electrode is an application electrode
00576         %>
00577         %> @retval S sensitivity map
00578         % =====================================================================
00579         function[S]=sens_map(ef_obj, V1, V2)
00580         [S]=sens_map(ef_obj, V1, V2)
00581

00585         %> @param S sensitivity map
00586         % =========================================================================
00587         function[] = draw_sensitivity_(ef_obj,S)
00588         [] = draw_sensitivity_(ef_obj,S, el1, el2, draw)             
00589          
00590         % =====================================================================
00591         %> @brief Sens_norm_lbp normalize sensitivity matrix coefficients
00592         %>
00593         %> @param S sensitivity matrix
00594         %> @retval Sn normalized sensitivity matrix
00595         % =====================================================================
00596         function [Sn]=sens_norm_lbp(ef_obj,S)
00597         [Sn] = sens_norm_lbp(ef_obj,S)
00598         
00599         % =====================================================================
00600         %> @brief Projections calculates capacitances to be measured with phantom
00601         %>
00602         %> @param error_V capacitance error amplitude e.g. error_V = 0.001 - 1 mV or 'none'
00603         %> @param range_V capacitance error range e.g. range_V = 10 - 10 V or 'none' 
00604         %>
00605         %> @retval out return value of this method
00606         % =====================================================================
00607         function [C] = projections(ef_obj,error_V,range_V)
00608         [C] = projections(ef_obj,error_V,range_V); 
00609         
00610    end
